channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid: Furlough cut 'could push businesses off cliff edge'
item.description: Making businesses pay more towards furlough could lead to job losses, unions warn.

item.title: Body-worn cameras for Denbighshire council staff after abuse
item.description: A man has been arrested after a parking warden was allegedly racially abused after issuing a ticket.

item.title: Sikh and Hindu ashes scattering site to open in Cardiff
item.description: A dedicated site for ashes to be scattered into flowing water is to be officially opened.

item.title: Pontypridd: Knife found as man hurt in town centre 'altercation'
item.description: Police are investigating after a knife was recovered after an "altercation" between three men.

item.title: Crickhowell rape: Police search for masked men after woman attacked
item.description: The "harrowing" early hours attack happened as she walked on the main road in a small rural town.

item.title: Dyfed-Powys Police appoints new chief constable
item.description: Richard Lewis is to return to the force after taking up the role with troubled Cleveland Police in 2019.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Karriss Artingstall takes bronze after Lauren Price guarantees medal
item.description: Karriss Artingstall takes Olympic bronze after a narrow defeat by Japan's Sena Irie, while Team GB team-mate Lauren Price beats Panama's Atheyna Bylon to guarantee at least a bronze.

item.title: British and Irish Lions bid for series win, but Rassie Erasmus is in the limelight
item.description: The British and Irish Lions will bid to go 2-0 up in a Test series for the first time since 1997 on Saturday, but Rassie Erasmus took the limelight in the game's build-up.

item.title: Cardiff: Murder arrest after sudden death of woman
item.description: Police say they are not looking for anyone else in connection with the woman's death.

item.title: Covid in Wales: Isolation for double-jabbed contacts to end
item.description: Wales will be the first UK nation to stop fully vaccinated Covid close contacts self-isolating.

item.title: 'Alarming' Swansea carer shortage prompts family SOS call
item.description: Family members are being encouraged to learn nursing tasks, such as changing dressings.

item.title: Mobo: Welsh music of black origin project started to 'help give back'
item.description: The new project will allow five singers and producers to be mentored by music professionals.

item.title: Bradley John 'should be coming up to his 18th birthday'
item.description: Father of Bradley John, 14, says the fact he "took his life" at school is "very, very symbolic".

item.title: Talking Books Wales: How one woman helped so many blind people read
item.description: After losing her sight in her 30s, Rhian Evans says she "used that disability" to help others.

item.title: LGBTQ people 'need to be part of' Wales' awareness push
item.description: It is hoped a new plan will see LGBTQ+ rights made mainstream across schools and the public sector.

item.title: Welsh slate landscape crowned a World Heritage site
item.description: The slate landscape of north-west Wales becomes the 32 UK site to be on Unesco's heritage list.

item.title: Woman who died in 'severe' pain at Cardiff home waited 'hours' for ambulance
item.description: John Whale's wife Maria died after they waited more than two hours for an ambulance.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Jasmine Joyce wants full-time sevens squad
item.description: After missing out on Olympic bronze, Team GB sevens star Jasmine Joyce wants the squad to become full-time.

item.title: Russell Martin: Swansea City approach MK Dons to speak to manager
item.description: Swansea City approach MK Dons to speak to their manager Russell Martin about becoming their new boss.

item.title: The Hundred: Welsh Fire beat Manchester Originals to earn first women's win
item.description: Welsh Fire earn their first win of the women's Hundred with a nine-wicket victory against Manchester Originals in Cardiff.

item.title: Michael Flynn: Newport County boss carries on after 'open and honest chat'
item.description: Michael Flynn reaffirms his commitment to Newport County following an "open and honest" chat with the club.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Great Britain finish fourth after Fiji sevens defeat
item.description: Great Britain's women's sevens side fall just short of a medal for the second Olympics in a row as impressive Fiji secure historic bronze medal.

item.title: Eisteddfod AmGen 2021 'fel Prifwyl arferol, ond heb gae'
item.description: Trefnwyr y Brifwyl i wneud "popeth yn eu gallu" i gael maes traddodiadol yn 2022, yn ôl y prif weithredwr.

item.title: Cyswllt Cymraeg â'r heddlu yn 'hawl, nid braint'
item.description: Prif Gwnstabl newydd Heddlu Dyfed-Powys am i bob cymuned dderbyn gwasanaeth trwy gyfrwng y Gymraeg.

item.title: Agor safle i Hindŵiaid a Siciaid wasgaru llwch anwyliaid
item.description: Wedi blynyddoedd o chwilio am leoliad addas, agor safle i bobl wasgaru llwch i ddŵr yn ôl traddodiad y ddwy ffydd.

item.title: Lauren Price yn saff o fedal yn y bocsio pwysau canol
item.description: Lauren Price yn saff o fedal yn y bocsio pwysau canol ar ôl buddugoliaeth yn rownd yr wyth olaf.
